title: Rex Wight
text:
Student of Physics

LinkedIn | rexjared86@gmail.com



Studying


Emphasis: Computation





Aug 2022 – Dec 2022

Implemented reinforcement learning algorithms to train virtual robots with TensorFlow.
Built a wrapper for Google’s MuJoCo environments for PNNL’s learner ExaRL.
Optimized Actor-Critic models using parallel computing techniques to enhance training efficiency.
Designed and executed experimental tests to support research and performance analysis.




Nov 2021 – Sep 2022

Instructed elementary and middle school students in programming fundamentals (e.g., loops, conditionals) via Zoom.
Collaborated with team to refine curriculum and enhance student engagement.
Fostered critical-thinking skills, inspiring 20+ students to pursue STEM projects.




Mar 2021 - Apr 2021

Applied machine learning (Artificial Neural Networks and Convolutional Neural Networks) and numerical methods to compute thermal diffusivities of Uranium-Molybdenum alloys.
Developed adaptable problem-solving strategies for complex scientific challenges.




Aug 2020 - Sept 2020

Reviewed and designed GUI for EFFTRAN, a Monte Carlo-based gamma-ray spectrometry algorithm, improving usability.
Developed a machine learning model to predict cladding thickness on irradiated fuel plates.
Wrote miscellaneous Python scripts for other projects as requested by my mentor.






Python
TensorFlow
Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, etc.
JavaScript
HTML
CSS
VisualBasic.NET
Processing
Arduino
Robotics
Leadership





September 2022 - now Brigham Young University Idaho




Physics
Calculus
Linear Algebra
Quantum Computing
Chemistry
Biology
